citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - Historic Places by 12-digit HUC for the Conterminous United States

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract: This EnviroAtlas dataset portrays the total number of historic places located within each 12-digit Hydrologic Unit (HUC). The historic places data were compiled from the National Park Service's National Register of Historic Places (NRHP), which provides official federal lists of districts, sites, buildings, structures and objects significant to American history, architecture, archeology, engineering, and culture. This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: This dataset can provide an indicator of historical significance for each 12-digit HUC, and can help identify important cultural resources that might need more protection or support. These historical places can be compared with the population distribution data to see if the public has sufficient access to these places, because they provide not only education but also opportunities for physical activity, which has been shown to greatly improve human health and well-being (Godbey, 2009). Secondly, the historical places can be examined together with data on environmental changes (such as water pollution, waste distribution, or air pollution; e.g., atmospheric deposition) to identify changes that could threaten the historical resources. Urban planners could take these historical places into consideration when selecting sites for highly polluting industries. For detailed information about how the historical places were defined, please refer to the NRHP Program (http://www.nps.gov/nr/research/). The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.
descript.supplinf: This dataset excludes all features deemed 'restricted' or 'sensitive' by the National Parks Service, such as sensitive archaeological sites. Places that are protected under state and local laws, but not listed in the National Register, are not included in this dataset.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html

procstep.procdesc: Downloaded 2013 National Register of Historic Places (NRHP) Cultural Resources Data Transfer Standards Formatted Geodatabase (NRIS_CR_Standards_Public.gdb) from the NRHP (http://www.nps.gov/nr/research/).

Each type of historical feature (point and polygon) within a geographic unit (12-digit HUC) was counted using ArcGIS 10.0 Spatial Join tool. Polygons typically represent sites over ten acres, and points represent smaller sites.
The total number of historical features was calculated by adding up numbers of historical places (districts, sites, buildings, structures and objects)
Data quality checking and making corrections.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

enttyp.enttypd: Number of historic places listed in the NRHP by 12-digit HUC.

attr.attrdef: Twelve Digit Hydrologic Unit Code. This field provides a unique 12-digit code for each subwatershed. Numbers were assigned in an upstream to downstream fashion. Where no downstream/upstream relationship could be determined, numbers were assigned in a clockwise fashion.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Guidelines, Requirements, and Procedures for the National Watershed Boundary Dataset; Chapter 3 of Section A; Federal Standards, Book 11, Collection and Delineation of Spatial Data; Techniques and Methods 11-A3.

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic sites, and depicted as points in NRHP's geospatial data. A site is the location of a significant event, a prehistoric or historic occupation or activities, or a building or structure, whether standing, ruined or vanished, where the location itself possess historic, cultural or archaeological value regardless of the value of any existing structure.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic sites, and depicted as polygons in NRHP's geospatial data. A site is the location of a significant event, a prehistoric or historic occupation or activities, or a building or structure, whether standing, ruined or vanished, where the location itself possess historic, cultural or archaeological value regardless of the value of any existing structure.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic buildings, and depicted as points in NRHP's geospatial data. A building, such as a house, barn, church, hotel, or similar construction, is created principally to shelter any form of human activity.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic buildings, and depicted as polygons in NRHP's geospatial data. A building, such as a house, barn, church, hotel, or similar construction, is created principally to shelter any form of human activity.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic districts, and depicted as points in NRHP's geospatial data. A district possesses a significant concentration, linkage, or continuity of sites, buildings, structures, or objects united historically or aesthetically by plan or physical development.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic districts, and depicted as polygons in NRHP's geospatial data. A district possesses a significant concentration, linkage, or continuity of sites, buildings, structures, or objects united historically or aesthetically by plan or physical development.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic objects, and depicted as points in NRHP's geospatial data. An object is a feature that is primarily artistic in nature or is relatively small in scale and simply constructed.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic objects, and depicted as polygons in NRHP's geospatial data. An object is a feature that is primarily artistic in nature or is relatively small in scale and simply constructed.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic structures, and depicted as points in NRHP's geospatial data. A structure is a building whose functional construction is made usually for purposes other than creating human shelter.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Properties listed on the NRHP, classified as historic structures, and depicted as polygons in NRHP's geospatial data. A structure is a building whose functional construction is made usually for purposes other than creating human shelter.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: Total number of all historical features.

All properties listed on the NRHP and classified as historic sites. A site is the location of a significant event, a prehistoric or historic occupation or activities, or a building or structure, whether standing, ruined or vanished, where the location itself possess historic, cultural or archaeological value regardless of the value of any existing structure.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: All properties listed on the NRHP and classified as historic buildings. A building, such as a house, barn, church, hotel, or similar construction, is created principally to shelter any form of human activity.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: All properties listed on the NRHP and classified as historic districts. A district possesses a significant concentration, linkage, or continuity of sites, buildings, structures, or objects united historically or aesthetically by plan or physical development.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: All properties listed on the NRHP and classified as historic objects. An object is a feature that is primarily artistic in nature or is relatively small in scale and simply constructed.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

attr.attrdef: All properties listed on the NRHP and classified as historic structures. A structure is a building whose functional construction is made usually for purposes other than creating human shelter.
attr.attrdefs: Cultural Resources GIS, NPS NRHP, NPS

overview.eaover: This data set records the total number of historical districts, sites, buildings, structures, and objects listed by the NRHP for the conterminous United States by 12-digit HUC. The number of each type of historical place was counted by selecting features of that type that were completely within the source layer feature (a 12-digit HUC) using Spatial Join in ArcGIS. The total count of all historical places was calculated by adding the number of historical districts, sites, buildings, structures, and objects. For more information about EnviroAtlas data, go to https://enviroatlas.epa.gov/EnviroAtlas/DataFactSheets.
